newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean bank lending/deposit rates fall in May.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean bank lending/deposit rates fall in May.

text.p: South Korea's bank deposit rates fell to a weighted average of 9.87 percent in May from 10.05 percent in April, the central Bank of Korea said on Tuesday.
A Bank of Korea statement said the weighted average of bank lending rates fell more slowly to 11.39 percent in May from 11.46 percent in the previous month.
Lending rates applying to large firms fell to an average of 11.35 percent in May from 11.75 percent, while those to smaller firms fell to 11.21 percent from 11.24 percent.
In South Korea part of bank loans to small- and medium-sized firms carry lower interest rates than the market's average levels under the so-called policy loan programme.
Benchmark three-year corporate bond yields fell to an average of 12.22 percent in May from 12.50 percent in April and the overnight call rates to 12.39 percent from 12.97 percent.
In May, the three-year yields were 1.44 percentage points above one- to two-year time deposit rates on average. The gap was 1.91 percentage points in April, the central bank said.
